description.narrative: Aimed at contributing to the development, piloting and monitoring of global tools and guidelines on RP tha are part of the Movement's response approaches, and making the results available to the NS in RPII as well as all members of the RCRC Movement and other RP actors.
Core RP activities are contingency planning ToTs and revisions, risk analysis manuals, DM trainings, simulation package rolled out, infrastructure facilitated etc.

Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement uses the RP tools, trainings and innovative approaches that are suitable for present-day needs and developed by the International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent (IFRC)

title.narrative: All innovative concepts have been documented through case studies (use, limitations, viability/business models, roll-out recommendations)

comment.narrative: Documentation! Case studies developed on Secondary data /IM/ CASH as per NS plan of action. 2017 Q2 cash Data Management solutions for cash programming implementation tested with support from the Data Management working Group and report available by June 2017. Included in annex. In Q4: DEEP secondary data analysis, and new Assessment and Planning in Emergency Operations has been documented Q4 CASH Red Rose data managment system has been developed and tested in Philiphines. In Q4: DEEP secondary data analysis, and new Assessment and Planning in Emergency Operations has been documented .Q4 2018: the Venezuela Population Movement Operation was the first regional pilot of the usage of the Analytical Framework and DEEP. This included transfer of ownership to the regional office. Q4 2018: the Venezuela Population Movement Operation was the first regional pilot of the usage of the Analytical Framework and DEEP. This included transfer of ownership to the regional office. Q42018: 6 case studies were developed as part of Cash Preparedness support evaluation. The case studies were developed during Q2 and Q3, and are in draft form. The case studies will be shared together with the annual RPII report in April.

Documentation! Case studies developed on Secondary data /IM/ CASH as per NS plan of action. 2017 Q2 cash Data Management solutions for cash programming implementation tested with support from the Data Management working Group and report available by June 2017. Included in annex. In Q4: DEEP secondary data analysis, and new Assessment and Planning in Emergency Operations has been documented Q4 CASH Red Rose data managment system has been developed and tested in Philiphines. In Q4: DEEP secondary data analysis, and new Assessment and Planning in Emergency Operations has been documented .Q4 2018: the Venezuela Population Movement Operation was the first regional pilot of the usage of the Analytical Framework and DEEP. This included transfer of ownership to the regional office. Q4 2018: the Venezuela Population Movement Operation was the first regional pilot of the usage of the Analytical Framework and DEEP. This included transfer of ownership to the regional office. Q42018: 6 case studies were developed as part of Cash Preparedness support evaluation. The case studies were developed during Q2 and Q3, and are in draft form. The case studies will be shared together with the annual RPII report in April.. Q3 2019: case study on use of new concepts such as Assessment Cell and new recovery approach in Mozambique Operation drafted. Expeting to share it during the Humanitarian Village of the statutory meetings

title.narrative: Number of RDRT receiving Cash/Markets/PECT trainings

comment.narrative:
2017 Q1 report: 1 PECT training hosted by ICRC in Nairobi: 14 non-ICRC trained participants, 2 FACT, 2 ERU, 2 RDRTs; from 10 NS, 1 IFRC. Cash moodle training (a 7-week online tutorized course, equivalent to IFRC/CaLP Level II) Jan to April 2017: 27 participants, 1 FACT, 6 ERUs, 7 RDRT/NDRT; from 19 NS, 1 IFRC 2017 Q2 report: PECT training in Kuala Lumpur, supported by American RC with participants from 13 countries. Participants included 5 NDRTs, 3 RDRTs, 3 ERU, 2 FACT and 1 Ops Manager/FACT/ERU. The rest were not members of surge teams.
2017 Q4: IFRC cash team supported the two PECT training during the reporting period, one hosted by ICRC in Geneva and the other by Spanish RC" 2018 Q2: 3 PECT trainings organized by ICRC, AmCross and British RC during the reporting period. Two members of RDRT/RIT participated into these trainings.

2017 Q1 report: 1 PECT training hosted by ICRC in Nairobi: 14 non-ICRC trained participants, 2 FACT, 2 ERU, 2 RDRTs; from 10 NS, 1 IFRC. Cash moodle training (a 7-week online tutorized course, equivalent to IFRC/CaLP Level II) Jan to April 2017: 27 participants, 1 FACT, 6 ERUs, 7 RDRT/NDRT; from 19 NS, 1 IFRC 2017 Q2 report: PECT training in Kuala Lumpur, supported by American RC with participants from 13 countries. Participants included 5 NDRTs, 3 RDRTs, 3 ERU, 2 FACT and 1 Ops Manager/FACT/ERU. The rest were not members of surge teams.
2017 Q4: IFRC cash team supported the two PECT training during the reporting period, one hosted by ICRC in Geneva and the other by Spanish RC" 2018 Q2: 3 PECT trainings organized by ICRC, AmCross and British RC during the reporting period. Two members of RDRT/RIT participated into these trainings. 2019 Q2: 2 PECT trainings organized by IFRC and Bulgarian Red Cross, and Turksih Red Crescent. 13 RDRTs participated in the PECT training during reporting period.

2017 Q1 report: 1 PECT training hosted by ICRC in Nairobi: 14 non-ICRC trained participants, 2 FACT, 2 ERU, 2 RDRTs; from 10 NS, 1 IFRC. Participants included 5 NDRTs, 3 RDRTs, 3 ERU, 2 FACT and 1 Ops Manager/FACT/ERU. The rest were not members of surge teams.
2017 Q4: IFRC cash team supported the two PECT training during the reporting period, one hosted by ICRC in Geneva and the other by Spanish RC"

title.narrative: 70% of the DREF and Emergency Appeals launched by he 5 RPII target NS incorporate ENA/IM/Cas

comment.narrative: Q2 2017: 1 DREF - CAR (Strong winds) MDRCF022; Q3 2017 DREF - CAR (Floods, Bambari) MDRCF023, DREF - Zambia (Pop. Movement) MDRZM010, Mali DREF food security (DEEP used by IFRC); Q4 2017: DREF-Zambia (cholera outbreak) MDRZM011; Q2 2018 DREF- CAR(EVDMDRCF024)

Q2 2017: 1 DREF - CAR (Strong winds) MDRCF022; Q3 2017 DREF - CAR (Floods, Bambari) MDRCF023, DREF - Zambia (Pop. Movement) MDRZM010, Mali DREF food security (DEEP used by IFRC); Q4 2017: DREF-Zambia (cholera outbreak) MDRZM011; Q2 2018 DREF- CAR(EVDMDRCF024). The DEEP was used for analysis of secodnary data for launching a DREF for Mali (also for other Sahel countries plus Burundi, Nigera, South Sudan, Somalia and Zimbabwe).

Q2 2017: 1 DREF - CAR (Strong winds) MDRCF022; Q3 2017 DREF - CAR (Floods, Bambari) MDRCF023, DREF - Zambia (Pop. Movement) MDRZM010, Mali DREF food security (DEEP used by IFRC); Q4 2017: DREF-Zambia (cholera outbreak) MDRZM011; Q2 2018 DREF- CAR(EVDMDRCF024). The DEEP was used for analysis of secondary data for launching a DREF for Mali (also for other Sahel countries plus Burundi, Nigera, South Sudan, Somalia and Zimbabwe). Q3 2018 DREF- Mali (floods MDRML013); DREF - Cholera Outbreak (MDRZW013). Q2 2019 Central AFrican Republic - Floods (MDRCF025), Q3 2019 Mali - Floods (MDRML014); Central AFrican Republic - Floods (MDRCF025)

comment.narrative: 2017 Q2 cash technical support TORs for Zambia and Travel plans developed. Field trip in July Q3 - Q3 During the 2017 RPII annual meeting , IFRC presented the NS preparedness for effective response approach, Surge optimization process and cash transfer programing. Dedicated session on the NS preparedness for response approach for Zambian RC took place

title.narrative: Relevant staff and volunteers are trained on the procedures and use of forms

comment.narrative: The first training with 31 participants on secondary data analysis and emergency needs assessment in Philippines in Q42017; Q4 PER assessments were piloted in Timor-Leste-25, El Salvador-22, Cuba-25, Armenia-18, Georgia-25. Q1 2018: PER pilot tests: Philippines-22, Azerbaijan-23, Greece-28 and Training in Tunisia- 26

The first training with 31 participants on secondary data analysis and emergency needs assessment in Philippines in Q42017; Q4 PER assessments were piloted in Timor-Leste-25, El Salvador-22, Cuba-25, Armenia-18, Georgia-25. Q1 2018: PER pilot tests: Philippines-22, Azerbaijan-23, Greece-28 and Training in Tunisia- 26

The first training with 31 participants on secondary data analysis and emergency needs assessment in Philippines in Q42017; Q4 PER assessments were piloted in Timor-Leste-25, El Salvador-22, Cuba-25, Armenia-18, Georgia-25. Q1 2018: PER pilot tests: Philippines-22, Azerbaijan-23, Greece-28 and Training in Tunisia- 26; Q2 2018 epi-PER conducted in: Indonesia 38, Uganda 45; PER Pacific regional training 12

The first training with 31 participants on secondary data analysis and emergency needs assessment in Philippines in Q42017; Q4 PER assessments were piloted in Timor-Leste-25, El Salvador-22, Cuba-25, Armenia-18, Georgia-25. Q1 2018: PER pilot tests: Philippines-22, Azerbaijan-23, Greece-28 and Training in Tunisia- 26; Q2 2018 epi-PER conducted in: Indonesia 38, Uganda 45; PER Pacific regional training 12. Three pilot workshops exposed 80 Red Cross and Red Crescent personnel (22 representatives from 14 National Societies, 1 ICRC, 35 IFRC staff from Geneva, 5 Regional and 3 Country office) to the new LEAP approach that aims to strengthen analytical process, aligning current practices with existing and arising assessment trends. Q3 2018: PER MENA facilitators training 22 participants from DMAG, NSs, PNSs

The first training with 31 participants on secondary data analysis and emergency needs assessment in Philippines in Q42017; Q4 PER assessments were piloted in Timor-Leste-25, El Salvador-22, Cuba-25, Armenia-18, Georgia-25. Q1 2018: PER pilot tests: Philippines-22, Azerbaijan-23, Greece-28 and Training in Tunisia- 26; Q2 2018 epi-PER conducted in: Indonesia 38, Uganda 45; PER Pacific regional training 12. Three pilot workshops exposed 80 Red Cross and Red Crescent personnel (22 representatives from 14 National Societies, 1 ICRC, 35 IFRC staff from Geneva, 5 Regional and 3 Country office) to the new LEAP approach that aims to strengthen analytical process, aligning current practices with existing and arising assessment trends. Q3 2018: PER MENA facilitators training 22 participants from DMAG, NSs, PNSs, Q4 training on CTP moodle, available in French and English; PER facilitators' training Caribbean 9, Barbados 7, Africa 17
